publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Herbert F. Baker Papers, 1904-1930
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Michigan Historical Collections Staff

did.abstract: Republican state representative, 1907-1912, speaker of the Michigan House of Representatives, 1911, state senator, 1919-1922, and official of the Farmers' National Council, the National Gleaner Federation, the Michigan State Grange and other farm and insurance organizations; includes correspondence, clippings, photographs and scrapbooks, concerning his political and business activities.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in 1977 by Tom Baker (donor no. 6066), son of Herbert F. Baker.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright to the collection has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Herbert F. Baker Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Herbert F. Baker was Republican state representative, 1907-1912; speaker of the Michigan House of Representatives, 1911; state senator, 1919-1922; and official of the Farmers' National Council, the National Gleaner Federation, the Michigan State Grange and other farm and insurance organizations

arrangement.p: The Herber F. Baker papers are organized into three series; correspondence and Miscellaneous Papers and Scrapbooks, and Photographs

scopecontent.p: The collection spans the dates 1904-1926 and contains five linear feet of correspondence, clippings, photographs and scrapbooks concerning Baker's political and business activities.

controlaccess.head: Contributors:
controlaccess.corpname: Farmer's Federal Tax League of America.
Farmers' National Committee on Postal Reform.
Farmers' National Committee on War Finance.
Lutheran Church-Missouri Synod. Michigan District. Lutheran Schools Committee.
Michigan State Federation of Women's Clubs.

did.unittitle: Papers, concerning the joint legislative committee to investigate the Michigan Community Council Commission, 1920-1921
Papers, concerning the Conference of Progressive State Granges, 1910-1912

scopecontent.p: The photographs series includes a tintype of Baker and wife, 1891; a tintype of Baker with others at National Grange Convention, 1911; photographs of barn raising, 1905, probably in Cheboygan County, Michigan; and photographs of Baker in the State Legislature and Legislative Committee Room.

index.head: Partial Index to Correspondence
index.p: Among the more significant individuals and organizations represented in the correspondence series are:

indexentry.corpname: Farmer's Federal Tax League of America
Farmers' National Committee on Postal Reform
Farmers' National Committee on War Finance
Lutheran Church. Missouri Synod. Michigan District. Lutheran Schools Committee

list.item: Letter, Aug. 15, 1924 concerning the parochial school amendment

indexentry.corpname: Michigan State Federation of Women's Clubs
